pullRequest.body:
`HasRingHomProperty P Q` is a type class asserting that `P` is local at the target and the source,
and for `f : Spec B ⟶ Spec A`, it is equivalent to the ring hom property `Q` on `Γ(f)`.
This replace the previous API `affineLocally` that is both slow and hard to use.

This is then used to refactor `LocallyOfFiniteType` and to deduplicate code.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

```

- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Restrict                      instructions    17.1%
```
!bench

Okay the deletion of those comments seems to have pissed off CI... not sure how to fix it.

Edit: Maybe it's fine.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ba600721-060d-48e0-845e-ef8cf1ab2bc2) for commit dd64e34ce22003a7a913897c2eee2f55e97e4edc.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/1e7c224b-af78-442b-a67d-faaaac050efd/to/ba600721-060d-48e0-845e-ef8cf1ab2bc2) against commit 81c06d9d36f838e878260a47b6034d476da4196f:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                Metric         Change
  ==============================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.RingHomProperties   instructions   -85.1%
```
Can you add a PR description saying a bit about the generalization?
Done.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10065226438/job/27823866290)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10065226438/job/27823865867)
Thanks! Apart from one comment, LGTM!
Thanks! Apart from one comment, LGTM!

```suggestion
and for `f : Spec B ⟶ Spec A`, it is equivalent to the ring hom property `Q` on `Γ(f)`.
```

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasRingHomProperty.iff_appLE`:
    `P f` if and only if `Q (f.appLE U V _)` for all affine `U : Opens Y` and `V : Opens X`.
```
and similarly below.

```suggestion
    (isLocal_ringHomProperty P).respectsIso
    (isLocal_ringHomProperty P).LocalizationPreserves
    (isLocal_ringHomProperty P).ofLocalizationSpan
```

As I understand it, `RingHom.PropertyIsLocal` should contain precisely what is needed for the associated `sourceAffineLocally` to be `AffineTargetMorphismProperty.IsLocal`. But it seems, not the full `RingHom.PropertyIsLocal` is needed. Should these two be aligned?

`RingHom.PropertyIsLocal` contains precisely what is needed for `affineLocally` to be local at the source and the target. `AffineTargetMorphismProperty.IsLocal` only guarantees that it is local at the target.
Can you please move this to the corresponding section in the `Morphisms.Basic` file?
I am wondering if we should make an `abbrev RingHomProperty := ∀ {R S : Type u} [CommRing R] [CommRing S], (R →+* S) → Prop`. Would make things less cluttered and would enable dot notation.
Sounds like a good idea. Will do it in a separate PR.
Could you point to `HasRingHomProperty.iff_appLE` here to explain the characterization?
I am not sure if this should be an instance, because it is not clear to me if `sourceAffineLocally Q` is always the easiest form.

Maybe factor this out as a lemma?
```lean
lemma RingHom.id_of_holdsForLocalizationAway (h : RingHom.HoldsForLocalizationAway Q)
    (A : Type u) [CommRing A] : Q (RingHom.id A : A →+* A) := by
  have := IsLocalization.at_units (.powers (1 : A)) (by simp)
  exact h A 1
```

Maybe the name should indicate that the cover is of the source, e.g. `of_openCover_source`? Maybe we can make the convention that `openCover` alway relates to the target and `openCover_source` to the source.
Nice!
This code looks better but ideally we should have some automation to do it for us...

```suggestion
    ⨆ i, f ⁻¹ᵁ U i = ⊤ := f.preimage_iSup U ▸ hU ▸ rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma locallyOfFiniteType_stableUnderBaseChange :
    MorphismProperty.StableUnderBaseChange @LocallyOfFiniteType :=
  HasRingHomProperty.stableUnderBaseChange RingHom.finiteType_stableUnderBaseChange
```
Ah I missed that. Thanks
Is this an indication that the `@[ext]` on `Scheme.Hom.ext` should be dropped?

I think when the user invokes `ext` when the goal is the equality of two morphisms, `Scheme.Hom.ext` is probably what one would expect, and we should allow this behavior. In this case I could instead change the `ext` to an `ext1` (which is what I should do instead) so I don't think this `ext`-lemma is that intrusive.

```suggestion
See `HasRingHomProperty.iff_appLE`.
-/
```
These still have wrong names, `HasAffineProperty` -> `HasRingHomProperty`.
This line is responsible for all the regression in the file. Tracing it crashes the LSP.
I changed it into a new proof that should be a lot faster. Let's see how the new benchmark says.
Great! It certainly looks much cleaner

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(AlgebraicGeometry): Introduce `HasRingHomProperty`.
